snippet: Officials said that the search of the rubble of a makeshift nightclub in the building would take days, and that they expected the number of victims to rise....
abstract: Fire rages through Oakland, Calif, warehouse during electronic dance show, killing at least 36 people; community of roughly 25 artists inhabited building, known as Ghost Ship, which was under investigation for code violations and had permit to function as a warehouse, but not residence or party venue; fire is considered one of worst building fires in United States in over decade and authorities warn death toll could climb significantly higher.

byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER, CONOR DOUGHERTY and JULIE TURKEWITZ
byline.contributor: Vindu Goel and Melissa Wen contributed reporting from Oakland, and Jonah Engel Bromwich from New York. Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Officials said that the search of the rubble of a makeshift nightclub in the building would take days, and that they expected the number of victims to rise.

headline.main: Death Toll in Oakland Warehouse Fire Rises to 36 as Search Continues
headline.print_headline: Death Toll Exceeds 30 in Ruins of Oakland Artists’ ‘Tinderbox
